field.name: groupId
field.description: The Group ID of the repository content.

field.name: artifactId
field.description: The Artifact ID of the repository content.

field.name: version
field.description: The version of the repository content.

field.name: classifier
field.description: The classifier of the dependency. This allows distinguishing two artifacts that belong to the same POM but were built differently, and is appended to the filename after the version. For example, jdk14 and jdk15.

field.name: type
field.description: The type of dependency. This defaults to jar. While it usually represents the extension on the filename of the dependency, that is not always the case. A type can be mapped to a different extension and a classifier. The type often correspongs to the packaging used, though this is also not always the case. Some examples are jar, war, ejb-client and test-jar. New types can be defined by plugins that set extensions to true, so this is not a complete list.

field.name: transitive
field.description: True if the dependency node is only here due a transitive lookup

field.name: url
field.description: This url will be provided to the user if the jar file cannot be downloaded from the central repository.

field.name: scope
field.description: The scope of the dependency - compile, runtime, test, system, and provided. Used to calculate the various classpaths used for compilation, testing, and so on. It also assists in determining which artifacts to include in a distribution of this project. For more information, see the dependency mechanism.

field.name: systemPath
field.description: FOR SYSTEM SCOPE ONLY. Note that use of this property is discouraged and may be replaced in later versions. This specifies the path on the filesystem for this dependency. Requires an absolute path for the value, not relative. Use a property that gives the machine specific absolute path, e.g. ${java.home}.

field.name: exclusions
field.description: Lists a set of artifacts that should be excluded from this dependency's artifact list when it comes to calculating transitive dependencies.

field.name: optional
field.description: Indicates the dependency is optional for use of this library. While the version of the dependency will be taken into account for dependency calculation if the library is used elsewhere, it will not be passed on transitively.

field.name: fromDependency
field.description: The dependency reference for the 'from' node

field.name: toDependency
field.description: The dependency reference for the 'to' node

field.name: type
field.description:
The type of edge you have.

runtime
A dependency node that is required for runtime of the project
test
A dependency node that is used by the project for testing purposes.
build
A dependency node that is used in the build/extension capacity.
plugin
A dependency node that is used as, or by a, declared plugin in this project. This includes the plugin itself, and any defined plugins/plugin/dependencies/dependency references.
report
A dependency node that is used as, or by a, declared report in this project. This includes the report itself, and any defined reporting/plugins/plugin/dependencies/dependency references.

field.name: artifactId

field.name: developerConnection

field.name: url
